Articles.Content:
I shoot it down.

My scrap.

I build a negative hill. You'll need negative bombs to destroy it, and negative bombs create matter. So I'll finally have a positive hill.

My average null hill.

Negative bombs, instead of releasing a fireball, release a giant iceball. So I launch my negative bomb at your negative hill. Sure, it's still yours, until I push your frozen body off of it. My positive hill

The cross-shaped positive hill, being unstable, rolled to the side. Now two can have the hill.

I own the other peak of Multiply Hill.
Your Multiply Hill gets Factorial.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, kerbiloid said:
> 
> 
> Your Multiply Hill gets Factorial.
> 

Hey it's my multiply hill too!

> 
> 
> 20 minutes ago, LazySoUseHyperedit said:
> 
> 
> Hey it's my multiply hill too!
> 

The hill doubles. [Double Factorial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factorial#Double_factorial) Hill.

RESET BUTTON

My school.

Your school.  

While others play KSP.

I now build a hill extractor, extracting one positive hill from the ground, leaving a negative hill behind. I use it in reverse, extracting one negative hill from outter space, and releasing a positive one on the ground.

My infinite hill generator.

I string the negative hills together in outer space, demanding money from [@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/) by threatening to crash them into the ground, thus deleting his hills.

I'll also use them on anyone that attacks [@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/) as long as [@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/) doesn't do anything to annoy me.

My negative hills in orbit. [@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/)'s positive hills on the ground.

[@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/) approves and agrees. I plant palm trees on my positive hills, and surround them with white sand beaches, letting [@greenTurtle1134](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167701-greenturtle1134/) use the negatives ones as he wants.

My positives atolls where to take some relaxing holidays.

I dig out my negative hills, filling the space with modern and slightly cramped staterooms complete with room service and a pool each. The resulting clods of negative dirt are kept as a weapon of last resort.

My negative hotels to stay on some relaxing holidays.

I build nice and comfortable beach resorts on my positives atolls.

My positives atolls with nice and comfortable beach resorts where to take some relaxing holidays.

Sea level had just went up.

My icecap.
Thanks to the planet axis precession, a thermal maximum begins. The icecap is melted.

You killed the penguins!!! And [@HerrCrazi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180017-herrcrazi/) and I still have our hills.

My environmental outrage.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-09-08T13:48:20Z" title="09/08/2017 01:48  PM" data-short="6 yr">September 8, 2017</time> by greenTurtle1134**

Still having nice holidays on my paradisiac hills ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I enough found time to build a boat with some wood I found laying at the ground ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

I broke kerbiloid in parts, melting them with cold water, and I create a brand new Icecap^TM^. Now there is even more penguins ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Loves Linux ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
\*casually nukes\* my irradiated penguins... on a hill (?)

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, greenTurtle1134 said:
> 
> 
> You killed the penguins!!!
> 

No-no! Penguins have happily learned to fly.  

(Except linuxes, they are linuxoids' problem, not kerbiloid's - I have windows to look into)..

The nuke also melts the upper ice layer and releases biological agents frozen inside, contaminating the icecap/hill.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-09-09T03:44:59Z" title="09/09/2017 03:44  AM" data-short="6 yr">September 9, 2017</time> by kerbiloid**

I uncontaminate the hill using magic science stuff, and everyone is so happy that the contamination won't spread, they award me the hill as a gift

Then I get the moderators to lock this thread somehow and it's my hill forever ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif ":sticktongue:")
If they lock this thread, you will have no power on this hill, and it will become a moderators' hill.,

The magical decontamination invokes the wrath of the nature previously destroyed and a whole pride of Lion's moves in while [@kerbiloid](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129408-kerbiloid/) distracts the meal-- uh I mean [@LazySoUseHyperedit](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/177646-lazysousehyperedit/) 

My Pride Rock!

I snipe you from 100 miles.

[@kerbinorbiter](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172446-kerbinorbiter/) beat me to the hill, so I snipe him too.

My hill.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-09-17T08:22:07Z" title="09/17/2017 08:22  AM" data-short="6 yr">September 17, 2017</time> by Joseph Kerman**

Looking into your sniper scope, you notice somebody with a laser designator in hands, observing your hill.  

Then you see a red flash, and since now your hill gets a name - One Eye Hill.
